TITLE: Kevin McCarthy’s Speaker Drama Raises New Fears on Debt Limit
SUMMARY: An emboldened conservative flank and concessions made to win votes could lead to a protracted standoff on critical fiscal issues, risking economic pain.

TITLE: Jack Ma, Ant Group Founder, Will Relinquish Control
SUMMARY: Ant Group, the fintech sister company of the e-commerce behemoth Alibaba, is one of China’s most influential companies.

SUMMARY: An investment frenzy over “generative artificial intelligence” has gripped Silicon Valley, as tools that generate text, images and sounds in response to short prompts seize the imagination.

TITLE: ‘Alexa, Why Do We Keep Buying You?’

SUMMARY: Young people are opting for point-and-shoots and blurry photos.

SUMMARY: The executive, for the Indian subsidiary of Wells Fargo, was fired after the investigation became public. Air India faces scrutiny for how it handled the matter.

SUMMARY: Across East Asia, populations are graying faster than anywhere else in the world, and while younger generations shrink, older workers are often toiling well into their 70s and beyond.

SUMMARY: In a perpetually tricky market for tech talent, large companies are turning to an in-house resource to get the word out.

SUMMARY: The Times wants to know how you plan to use technology differently this year.

SUMMARY: C-SPAN, the low-fi cable network beloved by the Congressional cognoscenti, has gotten a major boost in attention for its coverage of the House floor, now the site of a political battle for the ages.

SUMMARY: In a call with investors on Thursday, the chief financial officer of Walgreens, James Kehoe, said “maybe we cried too much last year” over theft.

TITLE: US Jobs Report: Employers Added 223,000 Jobs in December
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve’s moves to cool the economy with higher interest rates seem to be taking gentle hold. Wage growth lost momentum.

SUMMARY: Traders are betting that a slowdown in job growth and wage gains could reduce the pressure on prices and make the Federal Reserve less aggressive in raising interest rates.

SUMMARY: Friends and families are planning reunions; tourists are booking flights. But amid the anticipation, there’s a whiff of anxiety.

SUMMARY: The tech giant had already remade the virtual world. For a brief period, it also tried to make it easier for people in the Bay Area to get to work. Then it gave up.

SUMMARY: Prestige shows like “The White Lotus” grab a lot of the headlines and rave reviews. But viewers still like to settle in with the familiar.

SUMMARY: The broadcast on Saturday was a test of how the networks are going to cover the sport in the wake of Damar Hamlin’s collapse on the field last Monday.

SUMMARY: Sam Bankman-Fried, the disgraced cryptocurrency executive, pleads not guilty to an array of charges. A bumpy road ahead for Tesla. And the latest inflation figures are coming out.

SUMMARY: The $12 million PG-13 horror film brought in $30.2 million in ticket sales, behind “Avatar: The Way of Water,” with $45 million.

SUMMARY: Many people who want to work can’t because of long-term health problems, a persistent issue that is causing Britain’s economy to go “into reverse.”

SUMMARY: Inspired by digital art generators like DALL-E, biologists are building artificial intelligences that can fight cancer, flu and Covid.

SUMMARY: The C.E.O., Robert A. Iger, said in a memo that he thought the move would benefit the company’s culture and creativity.

SUMMARY: Environmental groups are relying on a law in France requiring large companies to address their environmental footprint.

SUMMARY: Analysts have begun trimming their profit forecasts, with pronounced downgrades for growth at energy and financial firms.

SUMMARY: Earnings season kicks off this week, and analysts expect a big drop in corporate profits and more announcements about layoffs.

SUMMARY: Trillions of dollars in government spending will profoundly affect the labor market, but in ways hard to measure, and mostly under the surface.

SUMMARY: The Securities and Exchange Commission fined Steve Easterbrook for lack of disclosure about the circumstances behind his firing in 2019.

SUMMARY: Many people who want to work can’t because of long-term health problems, a persistent issue that is causing Britain’s economy to go “into reverse.”

SUMMARY: President Emmanuel Macron is focusing on cutting costs in France’s pension system, but labor unions, which fiercely oppose the measure, have promised a showdown.

SUMMARY: When a Virgin Orbit rocket fell short of orbit, it dealt a blow to Britain’s space program and the companies whose satellites were lost in the mission.

SUMMARY: An “anomaly” prevented a rocket from reaching orbit after its release from a jumbo jet, Virgin Orbit said.

The F.A.A. was investigating the cause of the outage that delayed or canceled flights nationwide, but there was no evidence of a cyberattack, the Biden administration said.

SUMMARY: The company has discussed selling some user names through online auctions, people with knowledge of the plans said.

SUMMARY: If Congress fails to increase the government’s borrowing limit in time, the result would be a shock to the economy and financial markets.

SUMMARY: In a speech on Federal Reserve independence, Chair Jerome H. Powell emphasized that climate change should be addressed by elected officials.

SUMMARY: The payments processing start-up, one of the world’s most valuable private companies, could go public in the next year, people with knowledge of the matter said.

TITLE: Fireball Maker Is Sued Over Bottles That Don’t Contain Whisky
SUMMARY: An Illinois woman who wanted whisky, but got a cinnamon-and-whisky-flavored malt beverage instead, has sued the maker of Fireball for fraud.

TITLE: How Do Heavy Metals Like Lead Get in Baby Food?
SUMMARY: The problem begins at the farm where plants draw toxins from the soil. There’s no washing them away.

TITLE: Two Former Arkansas Officers Are Charged Over Beating Captured on Video
SUMMARY: The sheriff’s deputies used “excessive force” during the arrest of a man last year, the U.S. Justice Department said. The encounter was shared widely on social media.

TITLE: Biden Hammers Republicans on the Economy, With Eye on 2024
SUMMARY: The president has found a welcome foil in a new conservative House majority and its tax and spending plans, sharpening a potential re-election message.

TITLE: Dotdash Meredith, Publisher of People and InStyle, Cuts 7% of Staff
SUMMARY: The layoffs will affect 274 people, the company said.

TITLE: Toyota Names a New CEO as Akio Toyoda Steps Aside
SUMMARY: Akio Toyoda, who has been reluctant to embrace all-electric vehicles, will be succeeded as C.E.O. by a Lexus executive.

TITLE: Chipotle Beefs Up Hiring Ahead of ‘Burrito Season’
SUMMARY: The restaurant chain is pitching for more workers as it aims to double the number of outlets in North America.

TITLE: Video of Paul Pelosi Attack to Be Released Friday
SUMMARY: There was no reason to keep the footage secret, Judge Stephen M. Murphy of San Francisco Superior Court ruled. It could be released as soon as Thursday.

TITLE: How a Drug Company Made $114 Billion by Gaming the U.S. Patent System
SUMMARY: AbbVie for years delayed competition for its blockbuster drug Humira, at the expense of patients and taxpayers. The monopoly is about to end.

TITLE: When Private Equity Came for the Toddler Gyms
SUMMARY: The same playbook that has notched high returns acquiring things like foreclosed homes and highway rest stops is being tested by a family-oriented franchise.

TITLE: A Florida Judge Finds a New Job: Defending an Inmate
SUMMARY: In a coda to the wrongful-conviction podcast “Bone Valley,” Judge Scott Cupp says he’ll step down to spring a man serving a life sentence for murder.

TITLE: Sam Bankman-Fried’s Prosecutors Ask Judge to Tighten Bail Conditions
SUMMARY: The move followed the disgraced cryptocurrency executive’s attempt to contact a potential witness in his criminal case, prosecutors said.

TITLE: British Airline, Flybe, Collapses a Second Time
SUMMARY: Flybe, once the largest independent regional airline in Europe, canceled all flights on Saturday. A new owner failed to save the carrier, which was already struggling when the pandemic hit.

TITLE: ‘Buy Now, Pay Later’ Is the Victim of its Own Success
SUMMARY: What once seemed like attractive economics have been upended by increasing competition and rising interest rates.

TITLE: Easy to Use, Mobile Payment Apps Are Also Easy to Misuse
SUMMARY: While they have taken steps to help prevent mishaps, a new report finds they offer few protections if, for instance, users accidentally send money to the wrong person.

TITLE: His Boating App Needed a Boost. His Daughter’s TikTok Audience Came Through.
SUMMARY: Jeff Foulk spent years working on Argo Navigation, a GPS app for boats. After a TikTok video, it became one of the App Store’s most popular products.

TITLE: China’s Oil and Gas Use Fell in 2022 for First Time in Decades
SUMMARY: Pandemic lockdowns curbed Chinese energy demand, but the International Energy Agency expects a rebound this year.

TITLE: Anthropic Said to Be Closing In on $300 Million in New A.I. Funding
SUMMARY: Anthropic specializes in generative artificial intelligence, a hot investment in Silicon Valley. The new funding could value the company at roughly $5 billion.

TITLE: Gautam Adani’s Conglomerate Shaken by Stock Market Rout
SUMMARY: The Adani Group, founded by Gautam Adani, Asia’s richest person, has lost $50 billion in value this week as it rebutted a critical report from a New York investment firm.

TITLE: ‘GMA3’ Co-Anchors T.J. Holmes and Amy Robach to Leave ABC After Scandal
SUMMARY: T.J. Holmes and Amy Robach, who co-hosted “GMA3,” were both married when they began a romantic relationship.

TITLE: Goldman Sachs Cuts C.E.O. David Solomon’s Pay After Bank’s Poor Performance
SUMMARY: David M. Solomon earned $25 million in 2022, still a hefty sum but nearly 30 percent lower than a year earlier.

TITLE: Consumer Spending Fell Again in December
SUMMARY: Fresh data offered more detail on how shoppers retrenched at the end of 2022.

TITLE: Judge Orders Release of Video Showing Attack on Paul Pelosi
SUMMARY: There was no reason to keep the footage secret, Judge Stephen M. Murphy of San Francisco Superior Court ruled. It could be released as soon as Thursday.

TITLE: Can K-Pop Make the Metaverse Cool?
SUMMARY: In the world’s testing ground for tech, K-pop singers are being spun up out of pixels and doing battle in a virtual universe.

TITLE: Netherlands and Japan Said to Join U.S. in Curbing China’s Access to Chip Tech
SUMMARY: A new agreement is expected to expand the reach of U.S. technology restrictions on China issued last year.

TITLE: The Week in Business: Creeping Layoffs
SUMMARY: Data shows that the U.S. economy has been largely resilient. The Fed may slow its rate increases. And the jobs report is expected to show solid gains.
